string.text: 47-round 7.62x54 DP-28 Magazine
Heavy pan magazine that holds 47 rounds of 7.62x54R ammunition, for use with the DP-28. It is advised to bring a few of these if you plan on hunting Pseudogiants or Chimeras.
Standard .45 ACP Thompson Magazine

Standard 30 round Thompson submachine gun magazine chambered in .45 acp. The Thompson is not a gun that many would expect to find in the zone, perhaps a gunsmith with peculiar tastes has been producing copies.
.45 ACP Thompson Drum Magazine

50-round Thompson magazine for the Thompson submachine gun. Normally the M1A1 pattern of Thompson possesses a different mag weld that does not accept drums, however, aftermarket modifications have made them compatible.
Standard 7.62x39 Molot Vepr Magazine
10 round magazine for the 7.62 model of the Molot Vepr rifle. Due to modifications made to the RPK receiver, this rifle cannot use standard Kalashnikov magazines.
Standard 5.45x39 Molot Vepr Magazine

10 round magazine for the 5.45 model of the Molot Vepr rifle. Due to modifications made to the RPK receiver, this rifle cannot use standard Kalashnikov magazines. The magazine's design allows it to be modified to accept other calibers.
Standard 5.56x45 Molot Vepr Magazine

10 round magazine for the 5.56 model of the Molot Vepr rifle. Due to modifications made to the RPK receiver, this rifle cannot use standard Kalashnikov magazines. The magazine's design allows it to be modified to accept other calibers.
Standard 9x19 Mauser M712 Magazine
20 round magazine for the Mauser M712 pistol. As part of the process of developing the M712, the C96's internal 10 round magazine was replaced with a detachable 10 or 20 round box.
Standard 7.62x25 Type 80 Magazine
20 round magazine for the Type 80 pistol. While the Type 80 features a slower rate of fire compared to the Mauser M712 it was based on, these 20 round magazines still empty rather quickly.
Standard .45 ACP M3 Grease Gun Magazine

30 round magazine for the M3 "Grease Gun" smg. The M3 uses a magazine based on the British Sten gun magazine, using a double column, single feed design. This magazine was less reliable than the one used by the Thompson, it also required more effort to load.
Standard 9x19 M3 Grease Gun Magazine

30 round magazine for the M3 "Grease Gun" smg. Limited numbers of M3s were originally built in 9mm, along with some 9mm conversion kits. They were largely intended to be supplied to European resistance movements during German occupation, facilitating the use of captured ammunition.
Standard PPSh-41 Stick Magazine calibre 7.62x25
35 round magazine for the PPSh-41 smg. Compared to the drum, stick PPsh mags are considered easier and quicker to load, as well as more reliable. The drum is, however, more fun.
Custom M1A1 5.7x28 Magazine
30 round magazine for the custom M1A1 Carbine. As part of modifications from 5.7x33 spitfire parts to this current carbine, adjustments were made to facilitate the reliable feeding of 5.7x28.
9x18 Borz Magazine

25 round 9x18 stick magazine for a Borz smg. Like the Borz itself, these magazines may be homemade and compatible only with the gun they are found with. They could also come from other guns, but adapted for a given Borz.
9x19 Borz Magazine

25 round 9x19 stick magazine for a Borz smg. Like the Borz itself, these magazines may be homemade and compatible only with the gun they are found with. They could also come from other guns, but adapted for a given Borz.
Experimental 25 round 9x39 Tiss Magazine

Experimental 25 round 9x39 magazine typically found with the OTs-12 Tiss and clones. Never officially produced in great numbers, some individuals have taken to the design, refining and putting it into circulation.
Standard 9x19 Sten Magazine

Standard 32 round Sten Magazine. These magazines were notorious for their unreliability, an issue further exacerbated by a tendency of some users to use the magazine as a grip. An overly tight grip on the magazine or the magazine well could cause deformation and reliability issues and should be avoided.
Standard 7.62x25 Sa 24/26 Magazine

Standard 32 round Sa 24/26 Magazine. Unlike many other magazines for the bottlenecked 7.62x25 round that are noticeably curved, these magazines are straight, lending them to be used in some 7.62x25 conversions for some SMGs.
